title: Toronto JS Tech Talk Event [in person]
details:
Details
-------

Welcome back folks, to another exciting Tech Talk event at Snowflake on June 6th! Tonight is going to be exceptional, with not one, not two, but three fantastic speakers lined up, each ready to do a **30-minute talk** about a variety of topics. And guess what? **There will be pizza and non-alcoholic drinks waiting for you too!**

We are also thrilled to announce that Alex Okrushko from AngularToronto Meetup will be joining our event as one of the hosts and our MC for the evening. Make sure to mark your calendars and come out and join us for this very special event and discover what he has in store for us!

We are still finalizing the tech talks, and will update the agenda when we have more details, but here's a quick rundown of the schedule for the day:

**FEATURING**  
**"React TypeScript Patterns"** by Hassan Djirdeh  
[https://www.linkedin.com/in/hassandjirdeh/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/hassandjirdeh/)

**"TypeScript's Magic: Achieving End-to-End Type Safety Across the Full Stack"** by Joe Zhou  
[https://www.linkedin.com/in/zhehuizhou/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/zhehuizhou/)

**"Performance Optimization in [Next.js:](http://Next.js:) Tips and Techniques"** by Devang Sharma  
[https://www.linkedin.com/in/devang25/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/devang25/)

**Schedule:**  
**5:30pm** - doors "open"  
**6:00pm to 6:30pm** - "TypeScript's Magic: Achieving End-to-End Type Safety Across the Full Stack" by Joe Zhou  
**6:30pm to 7:00pm** - "React TypeScript Patterns" by Hassan Djirdeh  
**7:00pm to 7:30pm** - 30mins break time  
**7:30pm to 8:00pm** - "Performance Optimization in Next.js: Tips and Techniques" by Devang Sharma  
**8:00pm to 9:00pm** - networking time  
**9:00pm** - everyone goes "home"

**Please RSVP to confirm your attendance.** If you have your friends or teammates joining please ask them to RSVP as well.

**You can also RSVP at Guild:**  
[https://guild.host/events/js-tech-talk-in-person-x0nqk7](https://guild.host/events/js-tech-talk-in-person-x0nqk7)

This event is open to all skill levels.

Many thanks to Snowflake for hosting us!

We're looking for sponsors for events like these. If you or your company would like to support TorontoJS and get a message out to our community, please get in touch with \[[organizers@torontojs.com](http://organizers@torontojs.com)\]([mailto:organizers@torontojs.com](http://mailto:organizers@torontojs.com))  
The Code of Conduct is enforced at all TorontoJS events and spaces - online or in-person.

Gendered toilets and a single occupancy accessible toilet are available.  
TorontoJS is a volunteer-led not-for-profit organization. Please help us with tidying up. otherwise, the venue staff and volunteers will have to pick up after you.
